page.title: 11THORNHILL NEWSPAPER
page.content: Thornhill has no newspaper of its own because the village is very small.The newspaper that gets nearest to a local one is the "Stirling Observer".The "Observer"is published twice a week.On Wednesday there is the town edition.The country edition is read in the village more than the town one.The country edition carries much the same general news but all the villages in the district have their own "spot".Mrs.Carr is our local correspondent and sends in the news each week.Anything of interest in the village is reported and notices are also sent out in this way.Ifthere is something very important for the readers there is usually a picture.Our headteacher sends in school news which she knows people will enjoy reading about.
